comments.body: Glistering melons are just melons with gold shoved into them so I don't think it's that healthy
@fort nite  Yet we can eat Apples and Carrots that are made entirely out of gold.

yes it should definitely only give a half a heart  separate from saturation regeneration though.

But it should be instant health after eating it, just like the instant health potion it's used in.

I was about to make a post about this and then it showed your post, I think this is a great idea, it makes perfect sense, however I think that one slice should only restore 1-2 health points. I remember before the hunger bar was in the game eating food would directly heal you and I think this would be a great way to remember how things used to be.
Golden potato's anyone?

water melons don't give very much hunger already so I think it would make sense if it actually gave you none at all only regenerate like half a heart because it can stack maybe even less like it could have a small chance to regenerate half a heart and give no hunger, which would give people a good reason to turn them into instant health potions instead of it's still leaves the option to open.

"...it will cause less controversy in the younger Minecraft community..." 

What?!
Please, don’t comment your comments.
What do you mean?
Just vote.
I did vote.  I just think that the "cause less controversy" thing was strange, and I want to know what you meant by it.
They deleted my feedback before and I needed to fill empty space so they wouldn’t delete it again. I don’t know what that means.
When did the End get into this discussion?
Are you trying to say that they should add map for the end too?
No. I said that because you also mentioned End Cities which are different from the Nether.
Ooh sorry let me delete that part, tanks for pointing it out i just noticed that that doesn't make sense i meant to say Nether Cities

Maybe maps could illustrate the terrain at Y=30 (the level of lava seas).

We could still use them to find Nether Fortresses because most fortresses have netherbrick pylons that extend down into the lava, so would show up on the map.
You should be able to craft this new nether map buy chopping down the new types of wood in the nether to convert into a special type of paper in order to make the map!
Make sure to check out some of my other ideas.
Nice self plug Blast Burner. Upvoted.
It's till not tilt.
I really like your concepts @Blast Burner. Upvote for you.
Thank you very much FatalAcacia . :D
The hoe needs more love
You can already do that!
Villagers are smarter now, but they're still dumb enough to wander onto traps.  It would be funny though.
this would be incredible for map building

The shield ideas are good and creative but the problem is that the shield is supposed to stop damage from the front of the player, so having absorption will help only if your being attacked from the back, and 15 hearts is quite a lot for such a specific thing and in my opinion isn't worth all of the totems. Alternatively, you could make it so that having a totem shield in your hand/off hand, will give you 1 heart of absorption, regardless if it's being used or not, but would instead cost 1 totem. I would say this is a bit overpowered,considering how unprecedented extra health is in vanilla, despite the totem being needed, so I would have it so that it costs one totem, and having it activated gives you no absorption, but gives the regeneration and fire resistance of a normal totem, otherwise I think it's a good idea but I don't see it getting into the game.
It should be called Totem of Casing, but I'm still voting!
It would be to op but still a creative idea
I think it should just be a 1 totem and a shield so it works just like a totem so you can have a totem and a shield on at the same time
I would say the rings would be Magma Blocks. Makes more sense and fiery.
I say it should give them fire resistance, night vision, and haste seeing that water breathing is unless in the lava.

I think it would be really cool if it was a new block exclusive to the volcano biome. Like brimstone or burnt stone for the cage. The heart of the volcano could be found as a one in one hundred fifty in fortress chests.
This is overpowered and kiddish. I bet you got this from Minecraft Story Mode, a bad Minecraft related show.
This is a bad idea and it is too overpowered.

I like the idea of statues;

  • I would suggest that they are crafted with two of the same worked stone blocks and a head; forms a 2 high statue (dependent on the head type) in the material used. Different materials would have different poses.
  • Maybe when powered (redstone) they would spit fire onto the block they are facing? or attract that type of mob?
  • They could be waterlogged for underwater placement.
  • A name-tag could be used to put a plaque on the pedestal under it.
  • If hit by lightning they have the chance to spawn a mob based on the statue.

My only concern is that it imitates terraria: I would not have them spawn anywhere - only have them craftable.

I like the idea of adding a gargoyle, but here is my idea for how they will work: 

There would be a new underground stone village that is completely desolate. The only form of life would be stone statues known as gargoyles, but they are not a mob. These creatures are actually living blocks. They only move when you cannot see them and they will attack you behind your back. You can mine gargoyles as if it is a block, then you can place the gargoyle anywhere. The gargoyle will not be able to die, you cannot permanently destroy it, and it will have no drops or rewards. You could put every gargoyle you encounter inside a chest to prevent them from attacking you, or you could put all these living statues outside your friend’s house. ;)
Gargoyles would be great
Or you combine wool onto armor and make insulated [material] armor instead
Yeah that's true.
Wood armor would not make sense at all

Wood armor would:

  1. Prevent sinking in water.
  2. Be vulnerable to catching fire.
Why do feel like minecraft on xbox 1 used to have wooden armour
The Armor shouldn’t protect you from lava or fire, burn long, and should let you sink more slowly in water, or not at all

Brownstone serait appelé craie

c'est mieux

Should have brown cobblestone as well

Perhaps granite could be ground down into brown cobblestone and then turned into brown stone and brown stone bricks
Yes! I’ve been wanting brown bricks for so long! They need to make several more variants: brown, tan (softer than that neon end stone) and maybe a light orange-ish brick as well?
Great idea! I've also thought this would be cool. This or paint which would probably be more generic and open-ended than plaster.
I literally had the exact same idea but, to clarify, any texture in the game, or just colour?

My thought for Plaster or paint would be to incorporate balls of clay/terracotta and dye combined in a cauldron then use a feather or a sponge or a paint/plaster tool(feather+stick &/or sponge+stick).
I think it should be applied like a 0.1 width without blocking chests or other items that are not full blocks like a variant of carpets on walls. Alternatively it could be applied to item frames or paper.

Having the ability to cover a 1×1 block on any given side w/out obstructing the partial blocks around it will help to cleanup redstone builds and make them easier to incorporate in every build.

This will be good for making existing blocks more useful and thereby more desirable especially feathers & cauldrons.

I like the idea of using the cauldron to mass wet concrete. Throwing the items straight in the water to change them sounds just as cool. As someone who makes large pixel arts, this feature would be much appreciated ^-^

I agree,

This wouldn't suit Minecraft very well, but this could be extremely useful for adventure maps. I, personally won't really use it but many others probably.

I came here to post this very idea. My kids play survival mode but I only play creative mode and am currently building a large modern style city. It would be great to have an option of smaller bricks to add detail to builds plus bring a sense of scale of other things

I think we should be able to use 1/8th and 1/64 blocks, that's half, and quarter blocks per side.
Many builds suffer from this..1x1m blocks simply can't represent everything.

Making armor that is slightly weaker than iron, while using a lot less iron (by using nuggets, I assume you mean purely nuggets) would make iron armor more obsolete, since it would be easier to craft a new chain mail chestplate than spend 8x the resources for an iron one. You can already obtain chain mail armor from enemies in the overworld and from villagers.

Although chain mail armor is obtainable through trading, I would like to see it easier to get a hold of.

Now that chain blocks have been added to the game, this seems like a natural moment to do so
I like this idea but in bedrock ( idk about Java ) you can make chains and so you chould be able to make chain mail Armour out of chains
It is a good idea!
By attack speed you mean that the weapon can deal maximum damage faster?
Maybe the max damage would go down with a faster attack speed for a little balance.
This should be in the combat snapshots for testing.
If there was a name for this enchantment, its name would be Ferocity. Calling it.

i absolutely want it for 1.20!!!!    i need to do a katana with ferocity 10

ferocity name for enchanting
make the Attack Speed enchantment be a chestplate one.

I disagree that iron, gold, chain, and diamond armor should be dyeable. It makes no sense - also, let leather armor have its fun. Being dyeable is its only advantage over the others!

I do like your other idea a lot, though. Adding patterns to armor is a bit too much for me, but being able to decide which sections of your armor get dyed would be an awesome feature. It would open up the possibility of multicolored armor pieces. Nice!

I agree that actually the only purpose to craft leather armor is that it is dyeable. That's why i suggested to add only a small detail to the other armor types that can be dyed.

Because a full armor set covers a big portion of the player's skin. Being able to individualize the armor a litle bit would help to recognize other players faster. For example, adding a team color to the armor when playing a mini game with other players on a server. It is harder to differentiate when everyone has the same set of glowing enchanted diamond armor.

I support your suggestion to add patterns to the armor. My original idea though was to use loom to choose what you want to dye – a badge or shoulder pads or certain stripes on the armor piece – and when adding a second color to decide if the color should be split vertically, diagonally, …
It would be awesome to be able to apply a pattern to the center of the chest-plate as well.
I was gonna post something like this thx! You have my vote!
Not all people want that. We already have it, it’s called a shader, you can get one if you want it. Some people actually get motion sickness from looking at those.
Maybe the enchantment should be called “frost”, or “ice aspect”. Maybe even “freeze”
It should reduce the damage, though.
how about calling it "chill tag" because it is could of like freeze tag
I like Ice Aspect
I think this is an alright suggestion and I voted for this.
I think it should be crafted with magma and obsidian, instead of smelting it, as it just seems weird that you’d be able to half melt obsidian with a dingy old furnace.

My idea is that it's crafted using obsidian and glowstone dust/blocks. I'm still thinking about which one. I think it should be found in lava oceans in the Nether like upside-down clusters of glowstone. It could also be found in Bastion Remnant chests or bartered for with Piglins. I think it would look really cool, and I don't understand why Mojang removed this or even added it only in Pocket Edition. Some might say they removed it becaused they added glowstone instead, but I already said it could be found in lava oceans.
The water could also make corals grow, giving meaning to the name "heart of the sea".
Terrible idea, and also super redundant considering you can just wire TNT to a trapped chest to do the same thing. No support.
But TNT takes time to explode. Plus, you can hear it, so the victim wiuld probably run away with the valuables.

Exactly, so you strategically put the TNT wherever you expect the player to be after the TNT fuse has run out, not right where the chest is.

Also, just as a tip, I don't think the Mojang devs want to add features whose primary function is to grief more easily.
Who knows where they'd run?
they would only have one way to run in a tunnel
No one likes griefing.
Just put TNT under a trapped chest.  Does the same thing.
Also, You could always make it using commands.
